meanings.definition: Make (a sailing ship) unable to move due to lack of wind.
meanings.sent1: The wind stopped suddenly, becalming the ship in the middle of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailors had to becalm the ship by lowering the sails when the breeze died down.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pirate tried to becalm his rival's ship by stealing their oars.
meanings.sent4: The absence of wind seemed to becalm the ship, turning it into a floating island.
meanings.sent5: The stillness of the air becalmed the ship, leaving it stranded on the glassy sea.

meanings.definition: Cause to become calm or still.
meanings.sent1: The soothing music helped becalm the anxious child before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: Taking deep breaths can becalm your mind and reduce stress.
meanings.sent3: The gentle waves seemed to becalm the restless sea monster, lulling it to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words becalmed the angry customer, turning his frown into a smile.
meanings.sent5: The warm cup of tea becalmed her nerves, bringing a sense of peace and tranquility.
